activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion hearing on November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
To Judge McDougal
Preliminary hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:22 PM Defendant Jesse E. Shields in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja not in court. Attorney Forehand states there was a motion filed recently. Court resets.  

Attorney Forehand believes that a preliminary hearing hasn't happen yet. Court put the preliminary hearing date on at the same time a the motion hearing.

All parties must appear in person due to this hearing being in the small courtroom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:14 AM 2022CF000002, 2022CF000003, 2021CF000056 - Defendant Jesse E. Shields in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse E. Shields. Attorney Ocwieja states that an offer was given but not accepted by JS. Attorney Ocwieja speaks about cash bond modification and indicates that if bond isn't modified then a motion for a speedy jury trial will be filled. Attorney Ocwieja states that the victims are here today. Attorney Forehand speaks and objects to a bond modification. Victim speaks. 

Attorney Ocwieja asks for a condition to be add that the defendant "Take medication that is prescribed by his doctor." Court speaks. 

Parties speak about the 21CF56. Attorney Forehand suggest handling the revocation first.

JS would like a trial date.

Court will set a motion hearing re: revoking DPA for 21CF56 on 08/18 at 11:30.

Attorney Forehand possible will file a motion to join 22CF02/22CF03. Attorney Forehand asks for 3 days for the jury trial. 

Court speaks about bail. 
Court a signature bond on 22CF02
Continue to take Psychotropic medication as prescribed not how he feels it needs to be taken.
No contact with the victim except by telephone contact. Defendant shall not be at the residence of the victim.

Court order no contact with victim on 21CF56.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:15 AM 2022CF000002, 2022CF000003, 2021CF000056 - Defendant Jesse E. Shields appeared by video.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Jesse E. Shields. Attorney Forehand states that she just sent an offer to Attorney Ocwieja. Attorney Ocwieja asks for a quick turn around.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
for Bond Modification
Status conference on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

4:28 PM 2022CF000002, 2022CF000003, 2021CF00056 - Defendant Jesse E. Shields in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse E. Shields. JS states that he is competent. Court finds that JS is competent. Court speaks about scheduling. Attorney Ocwieja states that there is a DPA in 21CF56 which makes the case appear open. 22CF02/22CF03 - Attorney Ocwieja asks for a short turn around for a possible resolution and if not then a jury trial will be scheduled if needed. Attorney Forehand concurs with the scheduling.

10:43 AM 21CF56/ 22CF02/ 22CF03 - Defendant Jesse E. Shields not in court.  Attorney Harper on behalf of Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse E. Shields. Defense indicates that JS is at a resource center. Attorney Ocwieja states that information was given to the resource center. Attorney Ocwieja states that JS doesn't contest to the finding. Court continues to 07/22/22 at 4 PM. No finding has been made today due to not having the individual hearing in person.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Order to show cause hearing on July 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

For Treatment
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

03:50 PM Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video means for Defendant Jesse E. Shields. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesse E. Shields appeared by video means in the Richland County jail. Attorney Ocwieja comments about the second opinion and notes that his client had received the report but doesn't agree with it. JS states that he feels that he is competent. Attorney Forehand asks if JS is willing to stipulate or agree with being committed. JS agrees. Attorney Ocwieja explains to JS that if he agrees then he will be committed. JS asks when that would be. Court states it would start today. Court is hearing that JS doesn't agree but is in agreement to find him incompetent. Court orders that JS to take his abilify medication.
of Dr. Lee - comp eval (submitted to accounts payable 3/28/22)
Competency hearing on March 30, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Competency hearing on March 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:05 AM 21CF56/22CF02/22CF03 - Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video means for Defendant Jesse E. Shields. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesse E. Shields appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Court speaks about the report that was filed by the doctor. Attorney Ocwieja has spoken with JS. Attorney Ocwieja stated that yesterday he agrees that he isn't compent but today JS would like a second opinion. Attorney Forehand speaks about Doctor Taylor or Lee. JS agree with with the doctors. Court orders the additional examination that will be on the County expense. Attorney Forehand will prepare the orders for signature. Court resets.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:00 AM Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video means for Defendant Jesse E. Shields. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesse E. Shields appeared by video means. Attorney Ocwieja states that the report has been filed and it indicates that he is not competent but it can be regained. JS states that he accepts that he is not competent. Attorney Forehand hasn't seen the report. Court resets.  Competency hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
to Judge Sharp RE: extension to complete the evaluation
